intro: Fumaria sepium var. hurdana, commonly known as the yellow glory of the woods, is a herbaceous annual plant native to Europe. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and clusters of small, yellowish-orange flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and have a distinctive lobed shape with hairy surfaces. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas.
